instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarts when told to shut down
threads.message:
hi guys,
                      <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarts when selected shutdown . what area i should be looking into.
kindly advise 
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarts when told to shut down
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> tells me nothing 2008-2012 about 5 different models. Liquid damage? Usually LAN chip or airport. PRAM reset done?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarts when told to shut down
threads.message:
hi , 
 it was <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> . thanks for the reply as you pointed correctly i found liquid damage around lan ic . working fine now . 
thanks again . you can mark it solved .
